description: Check colorability of the figure-8 knot using connected quandles of order 4 (tetrahedral quandle).
knowledge_seeds: Figure-8 knot (4_1) is amphicheiral and not tricolorable; smallest connected quandle that colors it is order 4 (tetrahedral quandle, conjugacy class of 3-cycles in A4).
Quandle axioms: idempotence x*x=x, right-invertibility (columns are permutations), self-distributivity (x*y)*z = (x*z)*(y*z).
Wirtinger relations: at each crossing, under_out = under_in * over.

nodes.instruction: State figure-8 knot arcs and Wirtinger crossings (e.g., arcs 0-3; crossings (1,0,2), (3,2,0), (0,1,3), (2,3,1)). Summarize the quandle coloring constraint under_out = under_in * over.
Provide the multiplication table for the connected quandle of order 4 (tetrahedral quandle). Ensure it satisfies quandle axioms.

Use Python to search colorings of the figure-8 knot with the order-4 quandle table. Verify quandle axioms and search assignments of arcs so that all crossings are satisfied. Return whether a non-trivial coloring exists and minimum size. End with '#### 4' if confirmed.
Double-check the found coloring is non-trivial (not all arcs equal) and uses the connected quandle. If coloring fails, report failure and suggest larger n.
